column1: Team Lead - Supply Chain (Order to Delivery)
column2:
Job Description
As the OtD Scheduling Team Lead for the KL based team, you will take on an exciting challenge of running an operational business as well as looking for ways to motivate and inspire the team to exceed erformance expectations. Through your leadership and management skills, which you might have gained in a different role in Shell Malaysia, Shell Business Operations, within Downstream Supply Chain or even elsewhere, you will be expected to motivate and inspire the OtD team in the Kuala Lumpur SBO to create a daily delivery plan that fulfils our promise to our customers, for the lowest unit delivery cost; and to support the execution of that plan on a day to day basis through re-planning and pro-active customer management.
The OtD team has a significant influence on the satisfaction of our customers. The team needs to work closely with the Class Of Business (Retail; Commercial Fuels; etc) teams, along with the Customer Operations (CO) community, to ensure that plans and actions are aligned to flawless delivery of our customer offers. Your team's performance in this area is key to preserving and improving our reputation, and therefore our customer base.
The OtD team takes the lead in the optimisation of the road transport activity, ensuring that the delivery plans make use of our assets in the optimal way, resulting in the lowest delivery cost. The OtD team works closely with the local Road Transport and Facilities (Terminals) teams in both medium term planning and also the day to day execution of the plan. In order to do this well, you need to have a good logical brain, and an ability to understand where creative solutions can be explored further to develop real tangible benefits to the business.
Finally, the OtD team in KL is proud to be a part of the T&S; LEAN Accelerator Program, which is actively driving a transformation to running our operations in a LEAN way, underpinned by an active Continuous Improvement culture. The OtD teams are seen to be at the cutting edge of LEAN development in the Downstream, and so continuing to drive this change, and develop CI/LEAN capability is an essential part of this role. This gives you, the OtD Scheduling Team Lead, an opportunity for huge personal development and growth in this area as well the chance to share what you know with your team and colleagues.

Accountabilities
Based on global and local strategy, support the OtD Manager to develop and drive Order to Delivery plans that are fully aligned with stakeholders (e.g. Supply, Retail/Marketing, B2B). Drive the appropriate balance between Cost, HSSE and Customer Service level.
To lead the local Scheduling team in order achieve operational excellence in the day-to-day execution of Order Generation and Fulfilment, Routing & Scheduling, Dispatching, and Administration in the most cost effective manner.

Ensure that daily road transport operations (ordering, scheduling, delivering and administrating) meet all Group standards at lowest possible cost to service level

Manage day-to-day interface with Retail, Terminal Operations and Supply and give input to Secondary Transport Management in the S&OP; process, the development of CVP and the closure of Service Level Agreements.

Support initiatives of the data integration management and global IT initiatives for the secondary transport process e.g. implementation of Streamline (GSAP, Cross and VMI) and ensure the right use of software applications.

Support the Transport Contract Management and the Facilities Management to ensure the optimal provision and availability of assets (trucks, terminal availability, etc) in order to optimise value creation.

Support the development of performance improvement and best practice initiatives and support to manage their implementation.

Use scheduling performance data/KPIs (eg. Unit cost, stock-outs, utilisation, delivery schedule adherence) to optimize transport services and resources.

Coordinate with various Lines of Business (LoBs), and the Supply team within T&S;, and take an active role in the management of the supply / demand balance, including through the S&OP; forum.

Lead the transformation to the day to day running of the OtD activities in a LEAN way, underpinned by a commitment to Continuous Improvement. Be a visible advocate in this change, prepared to learn with the team and lead in a way that fosters this change.

Be an active member of the OtD KL Leadership team, helping to develop the wider OtD capability across the SBO KL OtD community.

Ensure proper staffing through attraction, coaching and development of people, covering aspects like D&I;, Competences, Performance Management and Recognition & Reward, supported by OtD manager.Dimensions :


Responsibility for OtD activities across Malaysia, Singapore, Indonesia and Hong Kong. Direct impact on Customer Satisfaction within these markets.
Optimisation of a road transport budget of USD 20-60 million per year.
Typically covering 4-6 hauliers, approx 400 drivers, and delivering to more than 1000 customers

Organization
8-10 direct reports

Special Challenges
Manage team with shift working (7days/week).
Managing the multiple interfaces with business partners (COB), customers and within T&S; and driving Enterprise First decision making.
Delivering the required Customer Service and Unit Cost performance for multiple countries from a single team where targets and operating conditions vary greatly by country.
Build strong partnerships with the OtD Team and between Order to Delivery, Supply and LoBs in order to ensure alignment of overall Order Fulfillment strategy.
Delivering OtD targets (HSSE, cost performance, customer service levels) for multiple countries from an offshore location.
Supporting of growing markets.

Additional comments

This role provides a unique opportunity to be part of an exciting leadership team that is pioneering LEAN ways of working in Shell. This is not another initiative that will lose its sparkle in the near future. The team has already been recognised for its significant progress in this area, and for the right candidate, the chance to continue to lead and inspire the team on this journey, challenging them to improve and outperform what they believe is possible should be very exciting. If you are keen to apply for this role and you want to understand the differences we have made in this area then please feel free to contact myself the hiring manager to see for yourself what we are doing.

Company Description
Shell is a global group of energy and petrochemical companies, active across more than 80 countries, employing 90,000 people.
Shell Business Operations Sdn Bhd (503619-D), a LEED Platinum certified green facility in Cyberjaya, provides a wide range of professional services to support the efficient operation of the Shell Group. The Centre delivers world-class operational excellence to the business through shared operations and services that include Human Resource, Information Technology, Finance, Customer Services, Order to Delivery and Contracting & Procurement. The Centre is currently on a growth path and as part of this rapid growth, we are looking to recruit talented professionals to join us!
If you would like to be a part of an innovative energy leader that offers a rewarding career in a multi cultural environment, then apply to us today and be a part of this vibrant, world-class organisation.

Company Background
Tessa Therapeutics is a clinical stage biopharmaceutical company with the scientific vision of revolutionizing the treatment of cancer by redirecting the bodys potent anti-viral immune response to recognize and kill cancer cells. Tessas core virus-specific T Cell (VST) platform has shown compelling results in the treatment of solid tumors, and the company is building a portfolio of therapies addressing a wide range of tumors by combining the qualities of its T cell platform with complementary technologies. Tessas lead Phase III trial for nasopharyngeal carcinoma (NPC) is the worlds largest Phase III T cell immunotherapy trial for any cancer indication. The company has built up robust operational and supply chain capabilities to successfully deliver autologous T cell therapy treatments to a large patient pool across five countries. The combination of technologies from its academic, clinical, and commercial research partners have enabled the company to create a fully-integrated approach to the treatment of cancer with immunotherapy.
Our mission is to cure cancers and save lives with our innovative and widely accessible immunotherapies.
We are looking for highly motivated and enthusiastic individuals who are interested to be part of our team.

Reporting to Manager, Credit Control, and the successful candidate will be responsible to assist the Manager in handling and managing all aspects of Credit Control matters. The successful candidate will handle and manage all credit control matters including trade debtors collections, trade debtors reconciliations, provision for doubtful debts, treaty, MNRB and etc. The successful candidate will also be responsible to provide agreed standards of service to customers (both internal and external).

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Monitoring and reduce/maintain ageing debtors outstanding balances to agreed targets:
* To assist in monitoring the debts to ensure of PW compliance and pursue the overdue debts with the respective marketing personnel.
2. Clearing Unmatched Receipts:
* To ensure that regular housekeeping (includes matching of payments and receipts, creating journal entries) of the accounts is being carried out so that the statement of accounts are clear and up to date.
3. Review and ensuring monthly reconciliation for Brokers, RI and Co-insurance Accounts are prepared on a timely manner and long outstanding reconciling items are investigated and cleared on a timely manner. Work with Broking and Underwriting team to clear the following:
* Long outstanding reconciling items.
* Unmatched receipts.
4. Provision for doubtful debt are adequately provided for:
* To assist in the tabulation of debtors balances reports to BNM and to ensure completion of those reports within the stipulated time frame.
5. Process refund premiums and brokerages:
* To ensure that the refund premiums to the clients and brokerages to the brokers are being processed in a timely manner.
6. Treaty and MNRB a/c
7. Customer Service:
* Ensure that good customer service is being rendered to the external and internal customers.
OTHER RESPONSIBILITIES
Carry out projects and other duties as may be assigned. Participate in and contribute to the successful development and implementation of projects related to Finance.
Qualifications
 JOB REQUIREMENTS
1. SPM and Diploma in any and/or related
2. AMII/ACII/DMII or equivalent insurance qualifications
3. At least 2 years of relevant working experience
4. Skilled in Microsoft Office and Microsoft Excel
5. Able to communicate with all levels
6. Able to work independently with minimum supervision

About AXA
Would you like to wake up every day driven and inspired by our noble mission and to work together as one global team to empower people to live a better life? Here at AXA we strive to lead the transformation of our industry. We are looking for talented individuals who come from varied backgrounds, think differently and want to be part of this exciting transformation by challenging the status quo so we can push AXA - a leading global brand and one of the most innovative companies in our industry - onto even greater things.

In a fast-evolving world and with a presence in 64 countries, our 166,000 employees and exclusive distributors anticipate change to offer services and solutions tailored to the current and future needs of our 103 million customers.
https://www.axa.com.my/
AXA Affin General Insurance Berhad is a joint venture between AXA Group and Affin Holdings Berhad. We are one of the fastest growing general insurance companies in Malaysia, and the No.1 leader in Medical and Health insurance (source: ISM). We provide comprehensive and tailored protection solutions to individuals and businesses in the areas of Motor, Home, Accidental, Travel and Commercial insurance.

We pride ourselves in conducting business responsibly, and building long-term relationship of trust when serving almost a million Malaysian customers, with over 800 employees in 22 offices, as well as over 4,000 agents nationwide, as well as our brokers and key bank partners.
What We Offer We are the best organization that demonstrate drive, commitment and tenacity to champion diversity and inclusion with workplace practices that enable our current & future employees to achieve work-life integration.

So, what are you waiting for? Come and JOIN us!

Content Executive
If you are looking for a career and not just a job, you are in the right path! At Shangri-La, we create an environment where our colleagues can achieve their personal and career goal.
Your Challenge:

As part of our multilingual expanding team, you will be responsible to monitor and managing all contents across various channels, for both digital and print content. You are responsible for creating, improving and maintaining one-stop content repository to achieve our business goals, and monitoring web traffic and metrics to identify best practices. You will need to be able to create an engaging and creative content and gaining insight into segmented audiences to produce tailor-made content. You should clearly understand the objectives of the organization, target audience, and must develop a simple, easy-to-understand, user friendly content while employing good search engine optimization (SEO) techniques. This position will require you to work alongside with Operation, Marketing and Communication team to optimize the existing content models ensuring the integrity of our content is maintained consistently for reliable and accurate publishing to multiple-channels and to be easily accessed and shared across multiple locations.
Our ideal candidate is an experienced professional with demonstrable creative writing skills and ability to think out of the box. As a Content Executive, you should be able to perform well under deadlines and be detail-oriented. If you are also an expert in content optimization and brand consistency, we would like to meet you.
Key responsibilities:
Assist the Content Manager in managing and maintaining one-stop content repository that facilitates many areas of functional work which include editing, auditing, creating and publishing content, capturing and transport structured or semi-structured information in paper or electronic format into a content repository for reuse, distribution, and storage.
To manage in-house CMS system  Ektron CMS and Episerver and working closely with external web content agency to ensure it is meeting the needs of the organization
Managing contents across various channels such as company website, companys mobile application, social media platforms, GDS, OTA and etc.
Transforming the digital properties to become the primary repository and distribution channel.
Attend project meeting and work closely with local marketing team/ content marketing/ communication team from various location (where applicable) to strategically deploy content library to deliver the best experience for users.
Ensure new content produced is compliant and properly approved with set internal guidelines and strengthen content credibility through daily review and proofreading for errors across multiple-platforms prior outward distribution.
Create and develop strategies for tactical campaigns/promotions to drive incremental traffic and conversion for rooms, F&B; and MICE.
Analyze and identify opportunities from online reputation platform.
Support the roll out of all campaigns (on content)
Use content management systems (CMS) or other repository system to analyze website traffic and users engagement metrics.
Keep up with trends in the digital media space, competitors activities and best practices
 You Need
Preferably min 3 years of working experience in Content Management or Digital Marketing in agency-side or brand-side exposure.
Hands on experience in using analytic tools such as Google Analytic and Ad Servers.
Strong command of web technologies including HTML templates, CSS and JavaScript.
Experience in using Ektron CMS, Episerver, Metadata, Sharepoint or any other repository platforms.
Highly analytical with strong understanding of media metrics.
Demonstrated critical thinking strategic thinking and problem solving abilities.
Excellent written/verbal communication and presentation.
Experience with analysis and designing impactful content.
Passionate about media technologies and stays ahead of the curve in terms of industry innovations.
Ability to converse & write in Japanese


What's In It For You?
5-Day work week
Earn attractive monthly salary
Freshly prepared meals
Laundry service
Smart Casual office attire
Paid Training provided
Sosco, EPF and medical insurance coverage
Complimentary Room Stay within the Shangri-La Hotels & Resorts
Familiarization trips within the Shangri-La Hotels & Resorts

Ability to be multi-lingual (speak and write in both English & Chinese)
Passion for the Internet
Ablility to work according to deadlines & targets
Details oriented and sound management of tasks skills

Digital transformation and global technology developments such as Cloud Computing, Service-Oriented Architecture and Mobile Computing are providing opportunities to organizations to re-look their IT strategies and architecture to achieve business innovation and attain value from their IT investments.

Having a well-structured IT Architecture is essential for organizations to respond well to new business challenges that arise from multiple sources ranging from rapid technology development to increasing global competition.
KPMG can assist organizations to develop an enterprise approach to architecture activities that underpin business case development and project implementation to achieve desired project outcomes. This IT Architecture service helps clients understand business issues and technical problems and then identify and architect solutions to optimally meet these requirements. Some of our key services (but not limited to) include:

Data Centre & Technology Platforms;Cloud Platforms & Infrastructure;Journey to Cloud, transformation & Compliance;Network Infrastructure;Resilience, Recovery & Contingency;Technology Architecture;Mobility, Workplace and User Computing;Application Modernization & Rationalization; andEnterprise, Information & Application Architecture.
Related keywords in this area are IT Strategy, IT Governance, IT Roadmap, Enterprise Architecture, SOA, ITIL, IT Infrastructure, Network,
Responsibilities :
As an associate Infrastructure and Architecture specialist your role is to evaluate the clients environment to identify gaps and recommend solutions to bridge those gaps for all projects assigned to you in relation to cyber threats.

You are also required to create reports to document the findings and state the solutions which will be used to present to the client. Your role will be as listed below but is not exhaustive.

Evaluate the clients network environment to determine weak links, suggest area of improvementMust have a good understanding of networking concepts WAN, LAN, Routing and Switching, Storage, Back Up and securityEvaluate network by evaluating network performance issues including availability, capacity planning, utilization, throughput, input/output, latency, testing and configuration and installationsConduct penetration test, vulnerability test and etc. to identify weak links in the clients network environmentTroubleshoot network errorConduct data center assessment to review the clients data center design, practices, governance and performanceFamiliar with storage/backup and restore best practicesTroubleshoot SQL servers, unix/linux based servers and etc.Create reports to documents findings
Requirements :
 A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science,/Information Technology/Engineering/any related field from an accredited college/university
Approximately 2 years of recent relevant work experience in IT infrastructure preferably in a consulting capacityMust have knowledge in WAN, LAN, Routing and Switching, Back Up, Storage, troubleshooting, Server management, Database and etc.Familiar with unix/linux (debian, redhat and etc.) administration including commands is a mustFamiliarization of information security framework such as ISMS, NIST, and COBIT5 or equivalent is a plus

POSITION SUMMARY

Purpose

The position is responsible for daily operation activities and carry out maintenance of H2 plants, auxiliary boiler, nitrogen PSA and filling of merchant unit. The incumbent shall follow work instruction for startup/shutdown plant; supply hydrogen gas and nitrogen to customer with specified quality meet and maintain/improve the plant reliability.

Nature and Scope

This position requires the candidate to perform day-to-day operation & maintenance activities at Air Products facilities  primarily at Westport and banting but also possibly extend to other operation plants at Malaysia region.

The person shall perform routine and breakdown maintenance activities to maintain plant machineries and equipment in reliable and efficient running condition

In the event of operation team manpower shortage, the person shall work in shift to perform operation activities which include but not limited to startup / shutdown / plant capacity adjustment / process parameter change.

The person will ensure all safety and ISO procedures are adhered to at all time.

When require, the person will need to provide mechanical support to commissioning team in central area.

About TMF Group
We help global companies expand and invest seamlessly across international borders. Our expert accountants, corporate secretarial and HR and payroll professionals are located around the world, enabling clients to operate their corporate structures, finance vehicles and investment funds in different geographical locations.
With operations in more than 80 countries providing outsourced compliance services, TMF Group is the global expert that understands local needs.
Job Purpose
An exciting opportunity for an experienced and talented Content Writer to join an award-winning team at TMF Group.

TMF Group is looking for a talented Content Writer to work in its Communications team writing outcome-driven content that funds brand awareness and generates enquiries on our services.

With a focus on the APAC region, the successful candidate will be required to work to and inform an editorial schedule which includes white papers, articles, blogs, sales enablement and social content. Success will be tied to the success of regional demand generation campaigns.

The final candidate will possess the ability to prioritise multiple demands and stakeholders. They will work to maintain and be the guardian of content processes and systems while producing consistent and dynamic content across a range of channels to generate demand in TMF Group.

Key Responsibilities:

Own a dynamic outcome-driven content schedule with a focus on APAC
Create content especially for the Global Brand Campaign
Generate content specifically to support the regional demand generation campaigns while ensuring alognment to the Global Brand Campaign and Group Marketing
Create trusted relationships with key senior spokespeople and subject matter experts in-region to generate sophisticated content aimed at C-suite level experts
Able to write on technical service-led content, including accounting and tax, HR and payroll and corporate secretarial
Content champion: work with colleagues to develop and flex the editorial schedule depending on how existing content performs. Govern the in-house content process and take part in regular editorial boards
Project manage and write one global piece of hero report content  devise and write content assets to support its launch (content in a box approach  articles, blogs, press releases, sales slides to support report)
Help internal customers to understand the briefing process and ensure all content is produced on time, to an agreed brief, budget and high standard. Book in translations when required
Schedule content based on priority, availability and resource. Manage requests and workflow into / through production
Be part of One TMF. Work well with diverse teams, in particular with the APAC Marketing team. Understand the impact and inter-reliance of content on Group Marketing activity and results
Key Requirements:

Minimum of 5 - 10 years experience in business content writing.
A professional journalism/ marketing qualification or degree is preferred.
Excellent attention to detail and proof-reading skills.
Excellent written and spoken English
The ability to prioritise a varied and demanding workload.
Excellent planning and organisational skills
Can do attitude
Willingness and flexibility to travel

Job Description
Purpose of Role
Responsible for the risk assessment of customers and the establishment of credit limits, the analysis of the overall credit exposure, the recommendation of terms of credit and the negotiation and management of security necessary to support higher risk exposures. Approval of credit limits, within delegated authority and obtaining the necessary MOA approval for exposures exceeding authority, approval of risk categories, and release of blocked orders. Actively support the sales account holders in credit issues. Provide support to the Credit Assessment Supervisor/Manager/Country Credit Manager as required.

Accountabilities

Manage Credit Risk
Responsible for the risk assessment of customers , negotiating and managing security arrangements, establishment of appropriate credit limits with necessary MOA and the analysis of the overall credit exposure. Responsible for the re-assessment of credit-worthiness of customers based on re-evaluation triggers, and timelines. Provide authorised approval for the release of blocked orders in respect of credit. Perform detailed financial analysis of customer financial statements for development of a risk profile of each customer using analytical results to establish credit limits within designated authority level and prepare analysis write-up to obtain necessary MOA for decisions exceeding designated authority level.
Ensure compliance with Global Downstream Credit policy, OCM standards & SOX controls. Meet/communicate with customers senior financial and business leaders to establish understanding of customers financial condition and business model as needed to complete credit analysis and to negotiate security when financial condition does not support credit exposure. Manage security arrangements to ensure timely actions taken to renew or replace expiring security instruments.

Manage Accounts Receivable
Responsible for ensuring that both Proactive and Reactive credit control takes place and ensuring that customers debt are collected in line with contracted payment terms. The authoritys decision would also need to be executed and documented by this role. Recognize financial risk situations on Trade Receivable Accounts. Exercise manual blocking of orders on high financial risk and seriously delinquent accounts. Recommend A/R provisions for bad debt.
Company Description
Shell is a global group of energy and petrochemical companies, active across more than 80 countries, employing 90,000 people.
Shell Business Operations Sdn Bhd (503619-D), a LEED Platinum certified green facility in Cyberjaya, provides a wide range of professional services to support the efficient operation of the Shell Group. The Centre delivers world-class operational excellence to the business through shared operations and services that include Human Resource, Information Technology, Finance, Customer Services, Order to Delivery and Contracting & Procurement. The Centre is currently on a growth path and as part of this rapid growth, we are looking to recruit talented professionals to join us!
If you would like to be a part of an innovative energy leader that offers a rewarding career in a multi cultural environment, then apply to us today and be a part of this vibrant, world-class organisation.

Able to speak, read & write in Mandarin
Degree in Accounting or any related Finance/Business course
Good knowledge of financial statements
Credit or OTC knowledge is an added advantage
With 1-2 years relevant work experience.

Professional Experience
This role requires a results-focused team player, with strong communication skills both written & verbal. He/She must be able to work under tight time pressure whilst still maintaining high standards of work. Ability to deal with conflict effectively and challenge the business when necessary. Knowledge of MI and Business Support, in order to advise and support business decisions. He/She should posses strong commercial acumen to be able to support the sales organisation in credit matters. He/She must be credible and be able to negotiate effectively with customers and their professional advisors face to face at the highest level within their organisation whilst valuing the customer relationship wherever possible.

Payment Services Officer - Contract
Some careers open more doors than others.


If you're looking for a career that will unlock new opportunities, join HSBC and experience the possibilities. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further.

Within HSBC Technology and Services, Global Service Delivery is a business-aligned, customer-servicing organisation with the primary objective of driving operational excellence across our businesses worldwide. Achieving this through the consolidation, simplification and continuous improvement of processes across the full range of HSBC operations, the division simultaneously takes responsibility for managing operational, location and processing risk and ensuring that services provided are at a best-in-class price point for the required quality level.

We are now inviting qualified individuals to join our Payment Services team in the role of Payment Services Officer - Contract .

Principal Accountabilities

Produce MIs and Reporting on a weekly, monthly and ad-hoc basis for country, regional as well as regulators.
Analyse and identify gaps / issues in processes and provide solutions for better tracking and performance.
Participate in streamlining projects and initiate continuous improvements across all key areas of payment operations, people, processes and system.
Drive Global Standard in the department in terms of projects, documentation, staff engagement as well as Sanction/FCC related matters.
Conduct investigations for payments and complaint receive by the departments.
Actively engage in Payments Transparency work in term of planning, system testing, execution of plans, attend meeting and detailed investigation of payments related issue if require.
Direct, plans, manages and controls the operations unit at Payment Services with the aim to create an Operations Centre of excellence to achieve highest operational efficiency and staff productivity.
Ensures the department complies with regulations, policies and procedures.
Bring the voice of the customers into the processes.
Safeguards the Bank from potential financial and reputational loss.


Qualifications
Requirements, Skillsets and Competencies


Required to possess good Microsoft Office especially Excel (statistical and analytical formulas) and PowerPoint knowledge ;
Familiar with Payments processing tool such as HUB,HFE2,GPI,GWIS,CCTS ;
Good analytical and "out-of-the-box" thinking ;
Ability to work independently and with minimum supervision.
Self-starter and proactive in identifying issue related to job scope.
Possess excellent leadership skill and good team player ;
Ability to successfully manage customer relationships with multiple business partners.
Good communication and presentation skills-both verbal and written.
Able to build and maintain positive and productive working relationship.
Ability to seek change, encourage change and drive change within the team

Requirement :

Bachelor Degree in Account/Finance or equivalent.
Min 2 yrs experience in related field.
Possess own transport with valid driving license and willing to travel.
Committed, able to work independently, high self-esteem etc.

Receive, unload, and process deliveries and account for incoming freight based on invoice and receiving reports. Stage merchandise by department, mark appropriately for placement in facility, and deliver merchandise to appropriate department. Verify and track received inventory and complete inventory reports and logs. Reconcile shipping invoices and receiving reports to ensure count accuracy. Receive, store, ship, and deliver incoming and outgoing department packages and mail. Secure the receiving room and its contents, ensuring safekeeping of packages. Follow all national, state, and local hazardous material shipping guidelines and regulations. Ship all out-going mail and packages. Verify quantity and condition of packages upon receipt prior to delivery to guest. Communicate with guest regarding received packages. Maintain accurate tracking system on all shipping and receiving transactions, including receiving guest signatures for received packages. Communicate with proper management regarding any loss or damage with packages. Report accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to manager; complete safety training and certifications.

Follow all company and safety and security policies and procedures; report any maintenance problems, safety hazards, accidents, or injuries; complete safety training and certifications. Ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional. Maintain confidentiality of proprietary information; protect company assets. Support all co-workers and treat them with dignity and respect. Support team to reach common goals. Comply with quality assurance expectations and standards. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 50 pounds without assistance. Read and visually verify information in a variety of formats (e. g., small print). Visually inspect tools, equipment, or machines (e. g., to identify defects). Grasp, turn, and manipulate objects of varying size and weight, requiring fine motor skills and hand-eye coordination. Reach overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting, pulling, and stooping. Move through narrow, confined, or elevated spaces. Move over sloping, uneven, or slippery surfaces and steps. Move up and down stairs and/or service ramps. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors.
